instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message:
Hi guys,
I'm working on a Macbook pro 15 inch 2017 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that fully works but external USB mouse and keyboard.
all the USB-C ports work, charging, Hard Disk & HDMI.
We have tried safe mode, external HD with different OS versions & different USB-C original adapters.
Magic mouse works fine as well as the internal keyboard and trackpad.

We tried USB mouse and keyboard with and without cable but none of them work.
the cable mouse turns on the light at the bottom but cable keyboard doesn't have any sign of getting power. 

This is the 3 time this mac comes to us.
The first 2 times came because it wasn't turning on, the first time we needed to replace two USB-C chips 
and the second time we needed to replace 3 USB-C chips.

Now everything works fine except for the external Mouse & Keyboard.

it has no pending Catalina updates and I couldn't fin any software issue related to the M&K.

What could be the problem on the motherboard?
what power rail should be present to make external USB M&K work?


Many thanks !

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message:
Seems that USB 3 devices are working; supposing you've tested external HDD with USB 3 connection.
Should be a problem with USB 2.0 lines.
However, test first with another USB-C hub.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message:
We did try a couple of USB-C hubs, new ones and from a working mac.
where should I start to check the USB 2.0 lines?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message:
J3300 and JB500 have two USB2 pairs (TOP/BOT) for each port.
Check diode mode on these lines.
<CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips stay between PCH and USB 2.0 inputs.
Also check diode mode on <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> outputs; L3100/200 and LB300/400.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message:
J3300
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_USB_TOP_P</SIGNAL> 1.31
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_USB_TOP_N</SIGNAL> 0.89
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_USB_BOT_P</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_USB_BOT_N</SIGNAL> OL

<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_USB_DBG_BOT_P</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_USB_DBG_BOT_N</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_USB_DBG_TOP_P</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_USB_DBG_TOP_N</SIGNAL> OL


JB500
<SIGNAL>USBC_TB_USB_TOP_P</SIGNAL> 1.92
<SIGNAL>USBC_TB_USB_TOP_N</SIGNAL> 0.00
<SIGNAL>USBC_TB_USB_BOT_P</SIGNAL> 0.75
<SIGNAL>USBC_TB_USB_BOT_N</SIGNAL> 0.75

<SIGNAL>USBC_TA_USB_TOP_P</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>USBC_TA_USB_TOP_N</SIGNAL> 0.80
<SIGNAL>USBC_TA_USB_BOT_P</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>USBC_TA_USB_BOT_N</SIGNAL> OL

L3000 0.54
1.- 0.54 4.- 0.54
2.- 0.54 3.- 0.54 

L3200 0.50
1.- 0.54 4.- 0.54
2.- 0.54 3.- 0.54

LB300
1.- 0.53 4.- 0.53
2.- 0.53 3.- 0.53

LB400
1.- 0.53 4.- 0.53
2.- 0.00 3.- 0.00

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message:
So... I have a short on <SIGNAL>USB_UPC_TB_F_N</SIGNAL> (I removed RB253)
I will replace UB400 and will update  (TOP/BOT) diode mode values as well as  L3000/200 and LB300/400

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message: ALWAYS check with red probe connected to ground!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message:
Yes, you are right, I did check like that the diode mode values, I'm using a fluke 107.
Once I replaced UB400 I got the following differences in values:

JB500
<SIGNAL>USBC_TB_USB_TOP_P</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>USBC_TB_USB_TOP_N</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>USBC_TB_USB_BOT_P</SIGNAL> OL
<SIGNAL>USBC_TB_USB_BOT_N</SIGNAL> OL

LB400
1.- 0.53 4.- 0.53
2.- 0.53 3.- 0.53

I still don't have external M&K..

I checked diode mode values on a working board and it looks like with my multimeter all the  (TOP/BOT) lines should be OL.
can you please confirm what diode mode values should I get on these lines?

If OL values are correct it could be that I need to replace another 2   <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message:
Did you check again output coils?
Pay atention to LB400.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message:
Its working !!!!!

To recap...

UB400 was shorting  <SIGNAL>USB_UPC_TB_F_N</SIGNAL> that's why  LB400 had 0.00V on diode mode in pins 2 & 3.

Testing again the USB M&K, we found external mouse activity only in one USB-C hub by connecting the adapter upside down which lead us to test once again with new USB-C hubs and BOOOOM ! external M&K working like a charm !

2informaticos thank you very very much!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> External USB mouse & keyboard not working
threads.message:
You're welcome!
Glad to hear you've solved it.
Thanks for solution feedback also.
